notes: Reproduced as reported: TIFF files cannot be decoded by any SkiaSharp API. SKImage.FromEncodedData() returns null, SKBitmap.Decode(byte[]) throws ArgumentNullException (Parameter 'codec'), and SKCodec.Create() returns null. This is consistent across all tested versions (2.88.3, 3.119.2, main source). TIFF has never been a supported codec in Skia — the SkEncodedImageFormat enum does not include TIFF, and no SkTiffCodec exists. This is working-as-designed behavior for an unsupported format, not a defect. Duplicate of #433; feature request tracked in #2993.

versionResults.notes: Reporter's version. All decode methods return null or throw.
Built from main branch. Identical behavior — TIFF remains unsupported.

reproductionSteps.description: Create console project with reporter's SkiaSharp version (2.88.3) and download the TIFF test file from the issue attachment.
reproductionSteps.command: dotnet new console -n Repro --framework net8.0 && cd Repro && dotnet add package SkiaSharp --version 2.88.3
reproductionSteps.output:
The template "Console App" was created successfully.
PackageReference for package 'SkiaSharp' version '2.88.3' added.

filesCreated.description: Console app that tests all TIFF decoding paths: SKImage.FromEncodedData (string/Stream/byte[]), SKBitmap.Decode (string/Stream/byte[]), and SKCodec.Create. Uses the reporter's TIFF file attachment.

reproductionSteps.description: Run with reporter's version (2.88.3). All TIFF decode methods return null; SKBitmap.Decode(byte[]) throws ArgumentNullException as reported.
reproductionSteps.output:
SkiaSharp version: 2.88.0.0
TIFF file exists: True
TIFF file size: 3977720 bytes

Test 1: SKImage.FromEncodedData(path)
  Result: null
Test 2: SKImage.FromEncodedData(stream)
  Result: null
Test 3: SKBitmap.Decode(path)
  Result: null
Test 4: SKBitmap.Decode(byte[])
  Exception: ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'codec')
Test 5: SKCodec.Create(path)
  Result: null

SUCCESS: test completed

artifacts.description: Reporter's TIFF test file (988x664, RGB, uncompressed, 3.9MB). Attached to issue as zip.

errorMessages.primaryError: TIFF decoding fails: SKImage.FromEncodedData returns null, SKBitmap.Decode(byte[]) throws ArgumentNullException (Parameter 'codec'), SKCodec.Create returns null
additionalErrors: ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'codec') — thrown by SKBitmap.Decode(byte[]) when SKCodec.Create returns null for unsupported format

triageCorrections.upstream: Triage classified as type/bug with 0.4 confidence
triageCorrections.corrected: Confirmed: the reported behavior occurs (reproduced), but this is working-as-designed — TIFF has never been a supported codec in Skia. This is a feature gap, not a bug.

actionability.reason: TIFF is not and has never been a supported image format in Skia. This is identical to #433 (closed 2018, maintainer confirmed TIFF unsupported). Feature request tracked in #2993.

workarounds: Use SixLabors.ImageSharp to convert TIFF to PNG, then load the PNG with SkiaSharp
Use BitMiracle.LibTiff.NET to decode TIFF to raw pixels, then create SKBitmap from pixel data
Use Magick.NET to convert TIFF to a supported format before passing to SkiaSharp

proposedResponse.summary: TIFF is not supported by Skia — confirmed with workarounds provided

actions.description: Relabel as feature request since TIFF non-support is by design
Mark as duplicate of #433 (TIFF not supported)
Cross-reference feature request #2993 for TIFF support
